intro: Crotalaria luxenii, commonly known as the golden crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with palmate leaves and erect stems. Its flowers are clustered in racemes and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Crotalaria luxenii is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it valuable in agricultural settings.
